timeline.bodyText: Maybe we can move this to a static concurrent set
timeline.author: manusa

replies.bodyText: Why static concurrent set? This is just more readable version of ke.getCode() != 200 && ke.getCode() != 503. It doesn't have any deeper purpose.
replies.author: rnetuka

replies.bodyText: Maybe a concurrent set is a bit overkilling in this case.
replies.author: oscerd

replies.bodyText:
It just doesn't seem optimal to create a new instance of a List each time the method gets called especially if the list is never changed.
It doesn't make sense either to make it concurrent since the list is never written to (besides when it's initialized).
Anyway, it's fine as it is. ✔️
replies.author: manusa
